definitions.text: the time when the Moon is fully illuminated
examples: the moon is at the full

definitions.text: beat for the purpose of cleaning and thickening
make (a garment) fuller by pleating or gathering
containing as much or as many as is possible or normal
examples: the auditorium was full to overflowing

definitions.text: constituting the full quantity or extent; complete
examples: an entire town devastated by an earthquake

definitions.text: complete in extent or degree and in every particular
filled to satisfaction with food or drink
(of sound) having marked deepness and body
being at a peak or culminating point

examples: the current taste for wide trousers

definitions.text: to the greatest degree or extent; completely or entirely; (`full' in this sense is used as a combining form)
